intro: Hoffmannseggia falcaria var. capitata, commonly known as the clustered hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheat. The species is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, lanceolate, and have a distinctive veining pattern. This variety is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
